channel.title: Spread the music
channel.description:
[center][b]Well, I thought I'd share some of my music with you folks. These are mainly emo/metal bands. I really enjoy listening too them.
This is NOT in alphabetical order.
In fear and Faith - Live Love Die http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uNYYX3e7LsQ
As I lay Dying - Through Struggle (Kind of old.) http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BhYT-7bzHis
Bullet for my Valentine - Tears don't fall http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7m_MJX58qk8&feature=fvst
Secondhand Serenade - Your Call (One of all time favorites.) http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0rgInHvW8Ic
The Red Jumpsuit Apparatus - Face Down (One of all time favorites.) http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4nckjoBALgM
Trivium - Pull Harder on the Strings of your Martyr http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4W8joPupu3Q
Boys like Girls - The great escape http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x5VdYqd6CdA
Breaking Benjamin - The Diary of Jane http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DWaB4PXCwFU
Owl City - Rainbow Veins http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2EsMHFXdLxI
Owl City - Hot air Balloon http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R6OQFnUrbW8
Side note: Owl City is one person writing all of his own music. I like him because he is original and his music is very uplifting and brings feelings of joy to everyone.
Haste the Day - The Minor Prophets http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ioYpxgTgNe4
Side Note: Something about this song takes you by your soul and makes you get sucked in to its beauty. -End of list as of July 05, 2009-
Anyways, I just thought I would share all of these with you. If you guys enjoy them I may add many more. :)
Please leave questions or comments! [/b][/center]

item.title: Spread the music
item.dc:creator: @slayer215 slayer215
item.description:
@slayer215 wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:19, topic:287265”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=379856.msg2857532#msg2857532 date=1246979117]

Please point me in the right direction. I just got 8 new CDs to listen to and I’d like more.

But the bands the TC of the other thread posted were terrible as I mentioned earlier, and Atheist/Cynic weren’t good for me either. I checked out all their songs on their Myspace.
[/quote]If you want fast, need not look further than death metal. Take a look at these :

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=avSNrQgDvhM (in terms of the acutal band, not one of their fastest but still great)

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uuy2soxQj3w

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MuvxSb2Rq4w

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QOb6JSQd-Qw

Look at them all, atleast listen to half way through as they have some pretty wicked solos.

Also, if you like Iron Maiden, heres a great cover of one of their songs:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KnjPcxcIVB4

Or if you like brittany spears, a death metal version of one of hers (for the lolz):

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_d7-2wooB9g

And here is an absolutely killer solo (not that its a cover and not the actual guitarist):

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_d7-2wooB9g

You just have to give the genre a chance, because if you listened to all of these you can see it truly isn’t “low chord spamming shit” like you may have previously believed. Just stay away from black metal, which in my opinion IS shit.[/quote]

you should hear http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MPpTolQiID0

song’s Move by Roope’s old band Waltari

Read full topic

@haticks wrote:

I like most death metal/metal/thrash/speed wutever. I wish more of it was instramentals tho. I can’t stand how they all sing about the same thing every song etc.

item.title: Spread the music
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Okay maybe fast wasn’t the word to describe it.
Some of the death stuff was good, in particular the solos. I couldn’t get into the rest of it though.

This might sound weird coming from a *core listener, but I can’t dig their voices. The voice has to match, and for me it doesn’t. I don’t like my music to yell at me. Screaming is alright. Yelling is weird. >_>

I used to listen to Children of Bodom, they’re cool.

For instance, this is what I’ve been listening to. Not the best on the CD, but I couldn’t find any other songs out yet. Must be cause it’s not all the way out yet.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=exuVP8iozVs

Lately I’ve also gotten into The Autumn Offering and Darkest Hour’s new CDs, but TAO guy’s voice in the new stuff just doesn’t fit with me.

Read full topic

item.title: Spread the music
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:17, topic:287265”]Please point me in the right direction. I just got 8 new CDs to listen to and I’d like more.

But the bands the TC of the other thread posted were terrible as I mentioned earlier, and Atheist/Cynic weren’t good for me either. I checked out all their songs on their Myspace.[/quote]If you want fast, need not look further than death metal. Take a look at these :

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=avSNrQgDvhM (in terms of the acutal band, not one of their fastest but still great)

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uuy2soxQj3w

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MuvxSb2Rq4w

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QOb6JSQd-Qw

Look at them all, atleast listen to half way through as they have some pretty wicked solos.

Also, if you like Iron Maiden, heres a great cover of one of their songs:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KnjPcxcIVB4

Or if you like brittany spears, a death metal version of one of hers (for the lolz):

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_d7-2wooB9g

And here is an absolutely killer solo (not that its a cover and not the actual guitarist):

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_d7-2wooB9g

You just have to give the genre a chance, because if you listened to all of these you can see it truly isn’t “low chord spamming shit” like you may have previously believed. Just stay away from black metal, which in my opinion IS shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Spread the music
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

SomethingToHide:

Now that I remember, I remember checking out the Atheist and Cynic you guys posted in particular. Neither of them did it for me. Too slow. Not enough awesome. The stuff I listen to is way more… just better in general. It sounds better. The drums are better. The guitar is more active. Sure Atheist had some solo-ey stuff. Nothing that made me say WOW. It didn’t make me want to do anything at all. Unlike what I listen to, which makes me want to move, get into the music, play the music, etc.

Cuz you listened the wrong songs…

Read full topic

item.title: Spread the music
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:10, topic:287265”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=379856.msg2856670#msg2856670 date=1246912445]
I can post a few “*core” bands that have much more talent than the mindless low-chord spamming shit you and others call *metal.
[/quote]
low-chord spamming shit?
have you ever heard cynic?[/quote]

I don’t remember which songs I listened to, but a few threads ago on here I listened to all the ones you guys posted, I didn’t hear any talent.

[quote=“Speljohan, post:11, topic:287265”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=379856.msg2856670#msg2856670 date=1246912445]
I can post a few “*core” bands that have much more talent than the mindless low-chord spamming shit you and others call *metal.
[/quote]I haven’t ever mentioned a “mindless low-chord” band. I only listen to tech stuff. If anything core-bands are the ones that are mindless, the lyrics are all about depressed teenagers who cry and whine about shit.[/quote]

You didn’t post them yourself, but you agreed with someone. Technical is already, but most music I listen to classified as metal and technical just sucks. Most of the stuff I listen to can be labeled as *core, but it’s not generic shit whatsoever. And I don’t even label it that. I consider it good metal. But when it’s classified as metal, most of the time, it sucks.

I can’t think of any lyrics by any of my listening (actually none of my all-time-favorites are *core) that is crying or whining about anything, and most of them aren’t teenagers.

[quote=“the bank, post:12, topic:287265”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=379856.msg2856670#msg2856670 date=1246912445]
I can post a few “*core” bands that have much more talent than the mindless low-chord spamming shit you and others call *metal.
[/quote]You sir, are retarded.[/quote]
Like you knew anything I’d follow up with at all…

Really. I hate labeling. And I hate the label *core. I don’t call anything a thing except hardcore or metal, and I almost use the two interchangably. The rest of it is useless labeling.

Now that I remember, I remember checking out the Atheist and Cynic you guys posted in particular. Neither of them did it for me. Too slow. Not enough awesome. The stuff I listen to is way more… just better in general. It sounds better. The drums are better. The guitar is more active. Sure Atheist had some solo-ey stuff. Nothing that made me say WOW. It didn’t make me want to do anything at all. Unlike what I listen to, which makes me want to move, get into the music, play the music, etc.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Aeolian, post:5, topic:287265”]Metal is considered to be different things in different places. Americans have our own view on what Metal is and should be, while other countries have a different view. Just because it doesn’t fit your view doesn’t mean it’s wrong.[/quote]Anything related to *core can instantly be disregarded. Sadly my country is infested with this shit as well, in fact most countries except for Germany and Brazil are.

item.description:
@k_a_h_leader wrote:

Metal is considered to be different things in different places. Americans have our own view on what Metal is and should be, while other countries have a different view. Just because it doesn’t fit your view doesn’t mean it’s wrong.

item.title: Spread the music
item.dc:creator: @k_a_h_leader Aeolian
item.description:
@k_a_h_leader wrote:

[center][b]Well, I thought I’d share some of my music with you folks. These are mainly emo/metal bands. I really enjoy listening too them.

This is NOT in alphabetical order.

In fear and Faith - Live Love Die
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uNYYX3e7LsQ

As I lay Dying - Through Struggle (Kind of old.)
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BhYT-7bzHis

Bullet for my Valentine - Tears don’t fall
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7m_MJX58qk8&feature=fvst

Secondhand Serenade - Your Call (One of all time favorites.)
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0rgInHvW8Ic

The Red Jumpsuit Apparatus - Face Down (One of all time favorites.)
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4nckjoBALgM

Trivium - Pull Harder on the Strings of your Martyr
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4W8joPupu3Q

Boys like Girls - The great escape
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x5VdYqd6CdA

Breaking Benjamin - The Diary of Jane
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DWaB4PXCwFU

Owl City - Rainbow Veins
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2EsMHFXdLxI

Owl City - Hot air Balloon
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R6OQFnUrbW8

Side note: Owl City is one person writing all of his own music. I like him because he is original and his music is very uplifting and brings feelings of joy to everyone.

Haste the Day - The Minor Prophets
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ioYpxgTgNe4

Side Note: Something about this song takes you by your soul and makes you get sucked in to its beauty.
-End of list as of July 05, 2009-

Anyways, I just thought I would share all of these with you. If you guys enjoy them I may add many more.

Please leave questions or comments!
[/b][/center]

Read full topic
